title: Staff Engineer, Test Environment & Frameworks
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companiesâ€”from the worldâ€™s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startupsâ€”use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyoneâ€™s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Test Environment Infrastructure & Frameworks team is responsible for accelerating Stripeâ€™s developers and providing a happy experience. We work on tools, processes, and code refactoring to accelerate Stripe engineering as Stripe scales.
The team has three main areas of responsibility. Our mission encompasses optimizing our QA infrastructure environment, advancing the capabilities of the Synthetics tool, and facilitating effective service-to-service testing. Through these efforts, we aim to improve the reliability of Stripe's systems and platforms, enhance the quality of deliverables, and ultimately foster a more efficient and innovative development process.
What youâ€™ll do
You will be responsible for defining, leading and owning the solutions for developer productivity problems, as well as the user experience of the platform. Driving the overall usage across the engineering teams. The scope includes engineers who iterate on features locally, and engineers who run end-to-end tests in any supported deployment environment such as QA or pre-production.
Responsibilities
Work with a wide range of systems, processes, technologies and fellow engineers to own and solve problems from end-to-end across multiple teams.
Make effective tradeoffs that consider business priorities, user experience, and a sustainable technical foundation.
Own and define the success metrics for the team.
Develop and lead the team to execute against both short-term and long-term roadmaps.
Identify, scope, and lead large technical projects, laying the groundwork for early-stage products to iteratively evolve and scale, and taming complexity and shoring up reliability of existing systems.
Work with engineers across the company to understand when existing infrastructure can be leveraged vs. when building a bespoke solution is prudent, and iterate on the current status quo.
Create a continuous feedback loop between the team and the rest of the engineering teams on stripe to help continuously prioritize against the needs of the broader engineering teams.
Who you are
Weâ€™re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
10+ years of professional, full-time software development experience
Enjoy working on new problems and unexplored areas.
Experience leading large projects across multiple teams and a track record of solving deep technical problems.
Experience designing, developing, maintaining and debugging distributed systems built with open source tools.
Experience writing high quality code in a major programming language, preferably Ruby, Java.
Experience building developer productivity tools (CI/CD, Testing tools, ..).
Enjoy working with others and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.
Preferred qualifications
Served as the technical lead and defined the roadmap for complex projects spanning multiple teams and functions.
Experience working with Cloud platforms, infrastructure as a code such as terraform, systems like kubernetes.
Proficiency in either Java or Ruby.
Experience leading other engineers is a plus.

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
